(Portable Projector 100'' Screen Included )

💖【200'' Giant Screen & ±15° Keystone Correction】: Portable projector provides 40-200 inch projection display, 6.8-16.4 feet projection distance, enjoy your 200-inch projection size with this outdoor movie portable projector family entertainment. Keystone correction and scaling make setting up and getting the perfect screen position a breeze - It's a great choice for families!

💖【Bluetooth 5.1 Function & HiFi Stereo Speaker】The projector has built-in powerful dual speakers and the latest Bluetooth 5.1 chip offers the best sound effects and excellent auditory sense experience. You can pair them together via Bluetooth technology to enjoy movies anywhere without having to worry about cables getting tangled or tripping over. (Bluetooth doesn't support connecting with smartphones, Only supports connecting with Audio devices).

💖【Multimedia Compatibility】: The home theater projector is equipped with HDMI / USBx2 / AV / 3.5mm headphone jack, compatible with Fire TV Stick, Roku, DVD, Laptop, USB, Computer, Headphone, External Speaker, iPhone Android, iPad, PS5, etc. You can use it for garden parties, home theater, outdoor camping, and more.

💖【Lifetime Customer Service Support】: This video projector is perfect for home entertainment, backyard, gaming, yoga, and parties. Enjoy peace of mind with lifetime professional customer service and technical support. Any questions about the HAPPRUN projector, please contact seller support, we will serve you online 24 hours a day！

When playing a video, why is there no sound? NOT support Dolby sound. If there is no sound when playing videos like Netflix, turn off Dolby sound.(Settings > Display & Sounds > Audio > Dolby Digital Output > and then turn Dolby Digital Plus OFF) The projector cannot play Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, Hulu and other videos Due to HDCP(High-bandwidth Digital Content Protection) agreement, Copyrighted videos such as Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, and Hulu must be played through Fire Stick, Roku, Computer, or laptop. The mobile computer cannot use the Bluetooth function of the projector Bluetooth function is ONLY for audio transfer with audio devices, NOT supporting video sync with smartphones and computers. The phone, computer, and Alexa cannot connect to the projector Bluetooth.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars All I needed
reviews.reviewText: I’m rating this five stars because of how much I’ve used it and how much I’ve enjoyed it. It is not perfect, dead pixels are starting to show up here and there and burn in is culminating in the middle (noticeable in darker pictures), but 6 months since I’ve bought this and I am so so so happy with it, I use it literally everyday and there has been days where it’s been left on and keeps on churning. (The picture is square aspect ratio so doesn’t really show the wideness) but this thing blows up huge. Pros, totally affordable and saved me 100s of dollars in going to theater, last time I went to the theater the screen looked tiny. Fan blows quietly you wouldn’t even know it was there. Clear image about 85 percent clarity and sharpness in the image but when the movies playing any tiny details aren’t even noticeable. Bluetooth function is very helpful. Menu is simple to understand. Light weight just pop it on a camera stand is what I did. Portable, though not battery powered I can through it in a bag easy and setup anywhere. Good construction. All around I’ve been super happy with it.ConsSome edges are a little blurred again not noticeable during the film, burn in after 6 months just a light faded color change in the middle noticeable in dark images. Small dead pixels, (might be dust on the light inside but I can’t reach it without getting a long screwdriver and taking it apart), not the easiest to get perfectly aligned but does a good job. Not great for low angles or high angles, better straight on like on camera stand or something. Somewhat dim in pitch black it works well and with just the smallest light you can still see, could be a bit brighter but still works, most projectors have that thing anyways. Not possible to get edge to edge image sharpness, I’ve tried for months but there’s always or corner or a side that is a little less sharp then the other but nothing major or noticeable when involved in a film. Weak speaker, hook up to something better to get full use.All around I love this thing, my friends love this thing my family loves this thing, we watch movies like everyday, so much so we can hardly find anything else good to watch. Thank you guys for this best product I’ve ever bought.Update the screen burn in is getting worse. Still love this thing but I think it’s gonna be out in about 3 months sadly. Hoping I can find a way t replace the led if possible

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Definitely an awesome projector!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this projector because I have a project that I'm working on that will require visuals on display. While wanting to have a short throw projector initially, after doing a bit of research I learned that a short throw projector wouldn't be a) cost effective, or b) a device to be used in the fashion I wanted. So, after some YouTube research, I learned about the Happrun H1 projector. I ordered it, and when it got here found that it even comes with a screen! I ordered a frame to put it on, and once that gets here I'll have more to write. But as for purchasing, it came with a remote, an HDMI cable, a component (red, white, and yellow RCA to 3/4 inch cable, the power cable, a screen to project on to, and the instruction manual. The bottom has a standard camera tripod port, which is excellent. In the use of the projector, you'll find that you can set the projection style from FRONT (projector is in front of the screen) or REAR (projector is behind the screen aka: rear projection), which is awesome — this is what I wanted. I didn't want people walking in front of the projector, and throwing up shadows or blocking the projectors output. The manual recommends giving the projector time to cool down after 6hrs of continuous use. I haven't tried pairing my phone or tablet to it via Bluetooth, but the options for that are also apart of the projector. It also has speakers, but I won't be using them. The noise from the projector (for me) isn't bad at all. If you're close enough, you can hear the unit's fans running, but I didn't find them to be of issue at all. So, if you were looking to get a projector, and this would be your first one, this is the one I would recommend you start with. A great projector, and it won't break the bank when purchasing. Enjoy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great projector for the price
reviews.reviewText: I bought this projector for $40 on Black Friday, I don't think I'd pay $100 for it, but it was a steal at $40. The speaker is pretty bad but it's relatively easy to connect to a Bluetooth speaker. The picture is good at 100 inches but the refresh rate must be pretty low, fast action scenes get pretty blurry. It's not the brightest projector but it's in my basement so works well for me. The included screen is so thin the light passes right through and makes a double image, so I had to hang a spare white sheet right behind it. Overall I'd give it 5 stars at $40, but I see it's $80 now, so I'd give it 4 stars at that price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Budget Projector You Can Buy!!!
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely thrilled with my Happrun projector purchase! This product exceeded my expectations in every way. The picture quality is stunning, offering vibrant colors and sharp details. Setting it up was a breeze, and the user-friendly interface makes navigation a joy. The compact design is a plus, allowing for easy portability. The built-in speakers deliver clear and immersive sound. Overall, the Happrun projector provides a top-notch cinematic experience. A solid 5 stars for its performance, quality, and value!Projector gets 5 stars but the screen it comes with gets 2 as the material is pretty much see through. I have the screen projected directly on my wall and it's much better than having it on the provided screen.
High definition and resolution, like you are watching inside the theatre. Highly recommended.

Purchased this to use in the kids play room so was never meant to be anything serious. This projector has me seriously impressed with the quality you get for the price, it has far exceeded my expectations. Easy to set up (Bluetooth audio is fantastic), used a cheap 210x210 vertical blind on the wall as a screen and all sorted. It's worth noting that the inbuilt speakers are pretty average, you'll almost definitely need a Bluetooth speaker instead. Well worth the money!
La verdad me sorprendió tiene buena imagen y el sonido es aceptable a media luz se ve muy bien y oscuro se ve excelente

For $100, this projector is shockingly good. It's native 1080p, seems nice and bright, and although it doesn't feel like a premium product, it doesn't actually feel that cheap either. It even supports 60hz and the input lag seems reasonable, making it not too bad for gaming. The speaker isn't even that bad either.. it's not amazing or anything, but it's honestly probably a better speaker than my much more expensive Epson projector.My wife and I bought this as a secondary projector, something we can travel with and bring outdoors etc and for that it's perfect.It has a single tripod mount on the bottom which makes moving it around a snap. You could probably even get away with using this as a permanent living room/theatre room projector as well if you wanted, but you will have to keep it's limitations in mind. To start, the lens is stationary, meaning there is no zoom whatsoever, you have to move it closer to further away to make the image smaller or larger. There is a digital zoom, but I wouldn't bother with that as it will only degrade the image. It does have a slight vertical shift though and it can also be mounted upside down, there's a setting to change the orientation. If you're really serious about having a permanent setup, I would recommend spending a lot more, but technically this could actually work..There is one larger gripe I have with this, the built in video player isn't that great. It seems to only support the h.264 codec and AAC audio, and more annoyingly it seems to stretch the video to fill the screen. That's a bit of an issue because a lot of movies are wider than 16:9, and if the video file was cropped to remove the black bars on the top and bottom, this video player will vertically stretch the image to fill that 16:9 output. So with those file limitations in mind I find this works best with an external device plugged in via HDMI, which makes this a little less portable.In the end though, this was $100 and the image quality is very good, especially for the price. If you're looking for a low cost projector and you want to spend the least amount possible I can't imagine you could do better than this.. I'm honestly blown away by this unit..
